metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7812 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The hypercall_create_continuation function in arch/arm/domain.c in Xen 4.4.x through 4.6.x allows local guest users to cause a denial of service (host crash) via a preemptible hypercall to the multicall interface.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3

xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required
